ghost

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • PApplet
      • ghost.App

  • public class App
extends PApplet
    The App controls the flow of the game, loading images, drawing them on the screen, and storing all the game objects to be called at the correct times

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      App() 
      App(java.lang.String filename) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      Calls tick and draw for each element to draw on the screen.
      Config getConfig()
      Getter for the App's associated config object
      int getEndScreenStartFrame()
      Getter for the frame on which the end screen of the game began.
      PFont getFont()
      Getter for the font used on the end screens
      java.util.List<Ghost> getGhosts()
      Getter for the App's associated ghost objects
      Map getMap()
      Getter for the App's associated Map object
      Waka getWaka()
      Getter for the App's associated waka object
      void keyPressed()
      A function called every time a key is pressed.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void restart()
      Instantiates all necessary components of the game (waka, map, ghosts etc.) and sets all relevant variables and flags to their starting values.
      void settings()
      Defines the dimensions of the screen
      void setup()
      Loads all images from filenames to PImages, and assigns them as sprites to the appropriate objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • App

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Loads all images from filenames to PImages, and assigns them as sprites to the appropriate objects. "The setup() function is called once when the program starts. It's used to define initial enviroment properties such as screen size and background color and to load media such as images and fonts as the program starts." - excerpt taken from the PApplet Documentation.

      • settings

        public void settings()
        Defines the dimensions of the screen

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed()
        A function called every time a key is pressed. The key code of the key pressed is stored in this.keyCode, and can then be accessed

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Calls tick and draw for each element to draw on the screen.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Instantiates all necessary components of the game (waka, map, ghosts etc.) and sets all relevant variables and flags to their starting values.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • getConfig

        public Config getConfig()
        Getter for the App's associated config object
        Returns:
        this.config

      • getWaka

        public Waka getWaka()
        Getter for the App's associated waka object
        Returns:
        this.waka

      • getGhosts

        public java.util.List<Ghost> getGhosts()
        Getter for the App's associated ghost objects
        Returns:
        this.ghosts

      • getEndScreenStartFrame

        public int getEndScreenStartFrame()
        Getter for the frame on which the end screen of the game began. If the game is not currently in the end screen, this value will be -1.
        Returns:
        this.endScreenFrameStart

      • getFont

        public PFont getFont()
        Getter for the font used on the end screens
        Returns:
        this.myFont

      • getMap

        public Map getMap()
        Getter for the App's associated Map object
        Returns:
        this.map
